examples.desc: Various processes simulated in a Cellular Potts Model (CPM). Mix and match elements from the examples to build your own simulations. Click to view.

items.name: Inspiring Magnets
items.desc: This model of self-organising spins inspired the CPM.

items.name: Staying Single
items.desc: A simple CPM cell with only adhesion/volume constraints.

items.name: Just Keep Swimming
items.desc: A "cell" with modified volume constraint goes for a random walk.

items.name: Back To The Classics
items.desc: The first CPM: cells sorting through differential adhesion.

items.name: Let It Grow
items.desc: A growing mass of proliferating cells.

items.name: Diffuse And Conquer
items.desc: A discrete approximation of Diffusion.

items.name: Distrac(k)ted
items.desc: Cells aligning their preferred directions.

items.name: Dora the Explorer
items.desc: A cell migrating actively by forming membrane protrusions.

items.name: One-Lane Traffic
items.desc: A migrating cell confined in a microchannel.

items.name: Swirl
items.desc: Two cells rotating on a micropatterned surface.

items.name: A Choreographed Dance
items.desc: Cells move in a global direction that changes over time.

items.name: Attraction At First Sight
items.desc: Cells move towards a specified target point.

items.name: Bull's Eye
items.desc: Cells moving up a chemokine gradient.

items.name: Catch Me If You Can!
items.desc: Cells attracting other cells through specific chemokines.

items.name: 50 Shades Of RNA
items.desc: Stochastic corrector model in the CPM.

items.name: Cell-ception
items.desc: Cells... with other cells inside.

items.name: Holding Tight
items.desc: A tightly packed layer of epidermal cells.

items.name: So Pushy...
items.desc: A layer of crammed cells expands over time.

items.name: I'm Just Browsing
items.desc: T Cells patrolling in the epidermis.

items.name: Licence To Kill?
items.desc: Immune cells invading (but not killing) a growing tumour.

examples.desc: Cellular Automata (CA) models are a slightly simpler class of grid-based models. Since a grid is implemented in Artistoo anyway, you can also use the framework to build CAs. Here are some examples.

items.name: The Prequel
items.desc: Before Game of Thrones, there was Conway's Game of Life.

items.name: Going Viral
items.desc: The SIR model of a spreading infection.

items.name: Crystal Clear
items.desc: A crystal growing through diffusion-limited aggregation.

examples.desc: There's more you can do with Artistoo! Look below for inspiration on how to make your simulations interactive, or to customize your outputs. The sky is the limit!

items.name: Click Flick
items.desc: Stop and restart this simulation via a simple mouse click.

items.name: Playground Slide
items.desc: Control this migrating cell's parameters via input sliders.

items.name: Control Room
items.desc: Control many different parameters via input fields.

items.name: Measure At Leisure
items.desc: Define your own statistic.

items.name: It's a wrap?
items.desc: Understanding boundary conditions.

items.name: You're a Viz-art, Harry!
items.desc: Painting pretty pictures... with a CPM.

examples.desc: Be warned: things become difficult once you go 3D. But to get you started, have a look at the example code in the examples/3D/ folder.

items.name: More Dimensions For Dora To Explore!
items.desc: An example of a 3D CPM.

explorables.title: Introduction to the CPM
explorables.desc: This explorable explains the algorithm and dynamics behind the CPM.

explorables.title: A CPM of Cell Migration
explorables.desc: This explorable describes a CPM extension that lets cells migrate actively.

explorables.title: Game of Life
explorables.desc: Learn all about the 'Game of Life', a classic model by John Conway that is surprisingly interesting despite its simple rules.

explorables.title: Back to the Classics: Cell Sorting
explorables.desc: In this explorable, we go back to the classics: the very first CPM that was designed by Graner and Glazier as a model for cell sorting.

explorables.title: Divide and Conquer: A Simple Spatial Model of Cell Division
explorables.desc: This explorable shows what happens when we link the CPM spatial dynamics and cell shapes to other processes, like cell division.
